cw:spiral.cw:title: LTER Completeness-Identification
cw:spiral.cw:description: Minimum content for adequate data set discovery in a general cataloging system or repository (functionally equivalent to LTER DTOC)

cw:spiral.cw:title: LTER Completeness-Discovery
cw:spiral.cw:description: Discovery level metadata should provide as much information as possible to support locating datasets by time, taxa, and/or geographic location in addition to basic identification information. Discovery level EML should include the coverage elements of temporalCoverage (when), taxonomicCoverage (what), and geographicCoverage (where) for the dataset as well as the change history in the maintenance element.

cw:spiral.cw:title: LTER Completeness-Evaluation
cw:spiral.cw:description: Evaluation level metadata should include detailed descriptions of the project, methods, protocols, and intellectual rights in order for a potential user to evaluate the relevance of the data package for their research study or synthesis project.

cw:spiral.cw:title: LTER Completeness-Access
cw:spiral.cw:description: Access-level metadata should provide a user with all the information needed to access and download the data tables, even if the tablesâ€™ attributes are not thoroughly described. The tags required at this level specify access control and the physical description of the table.

cw:spiral.cw:title: LTER Completeness-Integration
cw:spiral.cw:description: Integration-level metadata should support computer-mediated access and processing of data, and therefore requires that all aspects of the data package be fully described.
